item.title: 美国原油库存报告增加后油价有所回落
item.description: 周四，在一份行业报告显示美国原油库存增加，以及关税担忧打压市场情绪之后，油价走低，从上一交易日因担心俄罗斯供应中断而上涨的涨幅中回落。【原文：Oil prices edged lower on Thursday after an industry report showed a build in U.S. crude stockpiles and as tariff concerns weighed on sentiment, falling back from gains made in the previous session on worries over supply disruptions in Russia.】

item.title: 特朗普称正就 TikTok 与中国对话
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周三在 "空军一号 "上告诉记者，他正在与中国谈论 TikTok，因为美国正试图促成这一流行应用程序的出售。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump told reporters on Air Force One on Wednesday that he was talking to China about TikTok as the United States seeks to broker a sale of the popular app.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 Wesfarmers 公司利润超预期，面临关税通胀风险
item.description: 澳大利亚最大的非食品零售商威斯法默（Wesfarmers）表示，由于当地美元走软导致供应成本上升，该公司可能会提高价格，并在周四警告说，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普下令征收的关税可能会刺激通货膨胀。【原文：Australia's biggest non-food retailer Wesfarmers said it may raise prices as a soft local dollar drives up supply costs and warned on Thursday that tariffs ordered by U.S. President Donald Trump may spur inflation.】

item.title: 美国监管机构批准 Venture Global 提高普拉克明液化天然气产能和出口量
item.description: 美国联邦监管机构周三批准 Venture Global LNG 提高其路易斯安那州普拉克明液化天然气厂的出口能力。【原文：U.S. federal regulators on Wednesday gave Venture Global LNG permission to increase the export capacity of its Plaquemines, Louisiana, LNG plant.】

item.title: 受加拿大资产拖累，矿商淡水河谷亏损 6.94 亿美元
item.description: 巴西矿业公司淡水河谷周三报告称，第四季度亏损 6.94 亿美元，低于预期，与去年同期的大幅盈利相比有所下滑，原因是该公司在加拿大的一些贱金属资产出现减值。【原文：Brazilian miner Vale reported on Wednesday a $694 million loss in the fourth quarter, missing estimates and swinging from a hefty profit a year earlier, as it logged impairments on some of its base metals assets in Canada.】

item.title: 中国 2 月贷款基准利率一如预期保持不变
item.description: 中国在周四的月度定盘会上维持基准贷款利率不变，这表明当局在优先考虑金融和货币稳定的同时，正在缓慢实施货币刺激措施。【原文：China left benchmark lending rates unchanged at the monthly fixing on Thursday, showing authorities are going slow with monetary stimulus as they prioritise financial and currency stability.】

item.title: 日本铃木的目标是到 2030 年代初实现两位数的利润率
item.description: 日本汽车制造商铃木汽车公司周四表示，未来十年前半期的目标是营业利润率至少达到 10%，股本回报率达到或超过 15%。【原文：Suzuki Motor will target an operating profit margin of at least 10% and a return on equity of 15% or more for the first half of the next decade, the Japanese automaker said on Thursday.】

item.title: 交易员评估关税风险和政策前景，日元上涨，美元持稳
item.description: 周四，日元走强，美元持稳，因为投资者在思考美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的最新关税议程对全球经济意味着什么，以及它可能如何影响主要央行的利率前景。【原文：The yen firmed and the U.S. dollar held steady on Thursday as investors pondered what U.S. President Donald Trump's latest tariff agenda would mean for the global economy and how it could affect the interest rate outlook for major central banks.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，特朗普可能就乌克兰矿产问题寻求简化的初步协议
item.description: 两位知情人士周三告诉路透社，特朗普政府可能会寻求与乌克兰达成一项简化的矿产交易，以便迅速签订协议，随后再就详细条款进行谈判，例如美国将拥有多少乌克兰的大量资源。【原文：The Trump administration may seek to strike a simplified minerals deal with Ukraine to get a pact in place quickly and later negotiate detailed terms, such as how much of Ukraine's vast resources the U.S. would own, two people with knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 阿根廷总统米莱伊可能在华盛顿讨论美国铝关税问题
item.description: 阿根廷一个主要产铝省的省长周三表示，阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱伊（Javier Milei）可能会在即将对华盛顿进行的访问中讨论最近宣布的对美国进口钢铁和铝产品加征关税的问题。【原文：Argentine President Javier Milei will likely discuss the recently announced tariff hikes on U.S. imports of steel and aluminum in an upcoming visit to Washington, the governor of a top aluminum-producing province said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 伯克希尔哈撒韦公司出售 75 万股 DaVita 股票
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）表示，它在 2 月 14 日至 19 日期间出售了 75 万股 DaVita 的股票，将其在这家肾透析服务提供商的持股量减少了约 2%，降至 3514 万股。【原文：Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway said it sold 750,000 shares of DaVita between February 14 and 19, reducing its stake in the kidney dialysis services provider by about 2% to 35.14 million shares.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 1 月份失业率上升，就业形势依然一片大好
item.description: 周四的数据显示，澳大利亚1月份的失业率有所上升，尽管新增就业人数大大超过预期。【原文：Australia's unemployment rate ticked higher in January even though job creation handily outpaced forecasts, data showed on Thursday, a mixed outcome that does little to clarify the outlook for further cuts in interest rates.】

item.title: 研究人员称，从 Milei 支持的 Libra 代币中提取的加密货币价值 9,900 万美元
item.description: 区块链研究人员称，价值约 9,900 万美元的加密货币被从阿根廷丑闻中心的一枚硬币的市场中撤出，撤出者是与该加密代币创造者有关联的八个数字钱包。【原文：Around $99 million worth of cryptocurrency was withdrawn from the marketplace of a coin at the centre of a scandal in Argentina by eight digital wallets linked to the crypto token's creator, blockchain researchers said.】

item.title: 特朗普称将与国会共和党人合作 "大幅 "减税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周三表示，他将与国会共和党人合作，大幅降低个人和公司的税收。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday said he is going to work with Republicans in Congress to significantly reduce taxes for individuals and companies.】

item.title: 独家报道特斯拉因工人死亡事件被美国监管机构传唤
item.description: 去年夏天，特斯拉在德克萨斯州奥斯汀的汽车制造厂发生了一起工人触电事故，联邦监管机构已对特斯拉提出了违反工作场所安全规则的指控。【原文：Federal regulators have cited Tesla for violating workplace safety rules in connection with the electrocution of a worker last summer at its Austin, Texas, auto-manufacturing plant.】

item.title: 特朗普称将在 "下个月或更早 "宣布一系列关税措施
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周三表示，他将在 "下个月或更早 "宣布对木材、汽车、半导体和药品征收关税。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he will announce tariffs related to lumber, cars, semiconductors and pharmaceuticals "over the next month or sooner."】

item.title: 独家报道路透社调查显示，近九成日本公司认为特朗普不利于商业发展
item.description: 路透社周四的一项调查显示，近十分之九的日本公司预计美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的政策将对业务产生负面影响，这是美国第一大外国直接投资者日益担忧的最明显迹象。【原文：Almost nine out of 10 Japanese companies expect U.S. President Donald Trump's policies to negatively affect business, a Reuters survey showed on Thursday, the clearest sign yet of mounting worry in the United States' top foreign direct investor.】

item.title: 消息人士称埃克森和 SLB 对智利锂项目感兴趣
item.description: 据一份游说者会议登记表和一位熟悉内情的人士透露，美国石油巨头埃克森美孚公司正计划与智利官员会面，讨论锂投资机会，因为化石燃料公司正越来越多地寻求投资生产电动汽车电池所需的金属。【原文：U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil is planning a meeting with Chilean officials to discuss lithium investment opportunities, according to a registry of lobbyist meetings and a person familiar with the matter, as fossil fuel companies increasingly look to invest in production of the metal needed for electric vehicle batteries.】

item.title: 西南航空裁员削弱了其 "工人第一 "的文化
item.description: 西南航空公司在其近 54 年的历史上首次进行全公司范围的裁员，其目的是为了巩固利润，但这有可能会破坏以员工为先的公司文化，而这种文化曾使西南航空公司在众多竞争对手中脱颖而出，并培养了一批忠实的粉丝。【原文：Southwest Airlines' first company-wide layoffs in its nearly 54-year history are aimed at shoring up profits, but they run the risk of undermining a company culture of putting employees first that made it stand out from rivals and cultivated a loyal fan base.】

item.title: 竞争激烈，Grab Holdings 预计全年收入低于预期
item.description: Grab Holdings周三预测其全年营收将低于分析师预期，因为该公司正在努力应对食品外卖和打车业务的激烈竞争，这导致其在美国上市的股价盘后下跌超过8%。【原文：Grab Holdings forecast its annual revenue below analysts' estimate on Wednesday, as it grapples with intense competition in food delivery and ride-hailing businesses, sending its U.S.-listed shares down more than 8% after the bell.】

item.title: 澳大利亚澳新银行称第一季度减值资产增加
item.description: 澳大利亚第四大贷款机构澳新银行集团（ANZ Group）周四表示，抵押贷款重组的增加导致第一季度资产减值跃升至2021年以来的最高水平。【原文：ANZ Group , Australia's fourth-biggest lender, said on Thursday that a rise in mortgage restructuring contributed to a jump in asset impairments to their highest levels since 2021 in the first quarter.】

item.title: CF 工业公司第四季度利润增长，原因是合成氨销量增加
item.description: 化肥公司 CF Industries 周三公布，由于合成氨销量增加和价格稳定，其第四季度利润增长了近 20%。【原文：Fertilizer firm CF Industries reported a nearly 20% rise in its fourth-quarter profit on Wednesday, helped by higher ammonia sales and steady prices.】

item.title: 美联储杰斐逊表示，美联储可以在下一次利率决策上慢慢来
item.description: 美联储副主席菲利普-杰斐逊（Philip Jefferson）周三表示，美国央行有时间权衡其下一步货币政策举措，理由是经济强劲且通胀率仍高于目标。【原文：Federal Reserve Vice Chairman Philip Jefferson said on Wednesday the U.S. central bank has time to weigh its next monetary policy move, citing a robust economy and still above target inflation.】

item.title: 澳大利亚福特斯库公司上半年利润下滑
item.description: 由于铁矿石价格持续疲软，澳大利亚 Fortescue 公司周四公布的上半年利润下降了 53%。【原文：Australia's Fortescue reported a 53% drop in first-half profit on Thursday as iron ore prices remained weak.】

item.title: 贷款机构巴西银行预计 2025 年调整后利润在 65 亿至 72 亿美元之间
item.description: 巴西国营银行巴西银行（Banco do Brasil）周三表示，预计今年调整后的净利润将在 370 亿雷亚尔（约合 65 亿美元）至 410 亿雷亚尔（约合 72 亿美元）之间，而伦敦证券交易所集团（LSEG）民意调查的分析师预计为 392 亿雷亚尔。【原文：Brazilian state-run lender Banco do Brasil expects its adjusted net profit this year to be between 37 billion reais ($6.5 billion) and 41 billion reais ($7.2 billion), it said on Wednesday, while analysts in a LSEG poll estimated 39.2 billion reais.】

item.title: 早间竞标：中国设定利率，贸易战担忧消散？
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 美国高级军事领导人访问巴拿马，讨论安全和运河问题
item.description: 美国驻中美洲国家大使馆周三表示，一名负责监管拉丁美洲大部分地区行动的美军高级指挥官将于本周访问巴拿马，讨论安全合作以及巴拿马运河和移民问题。【原文：A senior U.S. military commander who oversees operations over much of Latin America will visit Panama this week to discuss security cooperation as well as the Panama Canal and migration, the U.S. embassy in the Central American nation said on Wednesday.】

item.title: UnitedHealth 称医院失误导致 Ackman 批评保险公司
item.description: 联合健康集团（UnitedHealth Group）称，医院在电话中的失误导致一名外科医生被从手术室拉出来，为一名住院病人辩护，此举最终遭到亿万富翁比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）的批评。【原文：UnitedHealth Group said a mistake at the hospital was behind the phone call that led to a surgeon being pulled from the operating room to defend a patient's inpatient stay, a move that was eventually criticized by billionaire Bill Ackman.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，Forever 21 计划在第二次破产中关闭近 200 家门店
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三援引知情人士的话报道，作为预计最快将于下月启动的破产程序的一部分，总部位于美国的 Forever 21 运营商正准备再关闭至少 200 家分店。【原文：The U.S.-based operator of Forever 21 was preparing to close at least 200 more locations as part of a bankruptcy process expected to kick off as soon as next month, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 电信公司澳洲电讯上半年利润增长，宣布回购 4.76 亿美元
item.description: 澳大利亚电信公司（Telstra）周四公布的半年报显示，由于各业务部门表现强劲，这家澳大利亚最大的电信公司的利润增长了 6.5%。【原文：Australia's Telstra reported a 6.5% rise in its half-year profit on Thursday, as the country's top telecom company benefited from strong performance across its segments.】
